column1: There are numerous experimental studies using mostly mice and rats showing that
column2: when these animals are reared in enriched environments
column3: they outperform those reared in non-enriched cages in terms of learning
column4: memory and visual acuity. These studies suggest that multiple circuits in the brain are modified
column5: leading to improved cognitive abilities. At the micro-anatomical level
column7: an enriched environment has been shown to induce an increase in neuronal complexity in the cerebral cortex. Similarly
column8: studies performed in the cerebral cortex of humans with different educational levels have reported an increase in neuronal complexity as educational levels increased.Thus
column9: the idea is not to try to sculpt our brain to become a genius
column10: but rather to make the most of our own individual genetic make-up through education to increase our cognitive capabilities. In other words
column11: sculpting our brain through our efforts at school would be amply rewarded with a greater brain capacity
column12: benefiting us both during and beyond our school years.
